entry.dcterms:description: the survey is part of the international comparative empirical survey series which examined the evaluation and acceptance of the various aspects of social justice in 1991 in 12 countries, and then in 1996 in 7 countries (out of this repeated in 5 countries); the data file contains the Hungarian data from 1991 and 1996

In 1991: a 1000-person national representative sample. In 1996: the basic population was the Hungarian population over 18 years. A three-stage random walking probability sample; at the first stage a random setllement sample was generated, in which 100 settlements were included. At the second stage the starting point for the interviewers to find the right house was randomly selected. At the third stage the appropriate household member was selected using the Leslie Kish-key. The number of cases in the sample after weighing is 1089.
